transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good morning, anjali. welcome to the interview for the backend engineer role. how are you doing today?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: good morning. im doing well, thank you. happy to be here.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: before we begin, ill give you a quick overview of the interview. well discuss your backend experience, python fundamentals, and some concepts related to api design and backend architecture. lets start with your background. can you tell me about your experience as a backend engineer?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: sure. i have around three years of experience working mainly with python. ive worked on backend scripts and some apis, mostly handling feature updates and bug fixes.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thats good. lets start with apis. can you explain what a rest api is?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: a rest api is used to send and receive data between the frontend and backend using http methods.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you name some common http methods and their purposes?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: get is used to fetch data, post is used to send data, put is for updating, and delete is for removing data.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good. how do you design rest apis to handle errors properly?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i usually use try-except blocks to catch errors and return messages, but i havent designed structured error responses.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you worked with standard http status codes like 400, 401, or 500?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i know they exist, but i dont clearly remember what each one represents.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: alright. lets talk about backend service architecture. have you designed any backend systems from scratch?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no, i usually work on existing codebases. i havent been involved in system-level design or architecture discussions.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you explain how you would structure a backend service for scalability?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i dont have much experience with scalability. i mostly focus on writing the logic given to me.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you worked with concepts like load balancing or caching?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have heard about them, but i havent implemented them myself.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: okay. how do you usually handle logging in backend applications?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i print logs for debugging, but i havent worked much with centralized logging systems.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you for your honest answers. do you have any questions for us?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no questions right now. thank you for the interview.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you, anjali. it was nice speaking with you. well let you know about the next steps.

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: thank you. have a great day.
